text: Muhammad Rafli (born 24 November 1998) is an Indonesian professional footballer who plays for Liga 1 club Arema, and the Indonesia national team. A versatile player, Rafli plays as a midfielder or forward, and has been deployed in a variety of attacking roles – as an attacking midfielder, second striker, centre forward and on either wing. He was also selected Nike Most Wanted player in 2016, an event that was once participated by Evan Dimas.Muhammad Rafli, Gelandang Serba Bisa Arema FC == Career == === Early career === He began to pursue soccer by entering the ASIFA. === Club career === Rafli signed a first contract with other players for Arema FC in January 2017. At Arema, he brought his club to the champions 2017 Indonesia President's Cup and 2019 Indonesia President's Cup. ==International career== He made his international debut for Indonesia U-19 on 14 September 2016 against Thailand U-19. Laporan Pertandingan: Indonesia U-19 2-3 Thailand U-19 and he scoring one goal against Laos U-19 on 18 September 2016. Laporan Pertandingan: Laos U-19 1-3 Indonesia U-19.He made his international debut for Indonesia U-23 on 7 June 2019 against Thailand U-23 and he scoring three goals against Philippines U-23 on 9 June 2019 at 2019 Merlion Cup.
